   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls which 'groups' are to run (with default values)
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_COUNTERS:   include
   27: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_CHUNKS:     include
   28: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_PING_PONG:  include
   29: %%
   30: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   31: %%
   32: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   33: %%
   34: 
   35: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   36: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   37: %%
   38: %% Run a specific group:
   39: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   40: %%
   41: %% Run a specific test case:
   42: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   43: %%
   44: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   45: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   46: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   47: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   48: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   49: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   50: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   51: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   52: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   53: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   54: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   55: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   56: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   57: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   58: %%
   59: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   60: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   61: 
   62: 
   63: 
   64: -module(socket_traffic_SUITE).
   65: 
   66: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   67: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   68: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   69: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   70: 
   71: %% Suite exports
   72: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   73: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   74:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   75:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   76:

  155: -define(KLIB,       kernel_test_lib).
  156: -define(LOGGER,     socket_test_logger).

  158: -define(DATA,       <<"HOPPSAN">>). % Temporary
  159: -define(FAIL(R),    exit(R)).
  160: 
  161: -define(TPP_SMALL,  lists:seq(1, 8)).
  162: -define(TPP_MEDIUM, lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(100, ?TPP_SMALL))).
  163: -define(TPP_LARGE,  lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(100, ?TPP_MEDIUM))).
  164: 
  165: -define(TPP_SMALL_NUM,  5000).
  166: -define(TPP_MEDIUM_NUM, 500).
  167: -define(TPP_LARGE_NUM,  50).
  168: -define(TPP_NUM(Config, Base), (Base) div lookup(kernel_factor, 1, Config)).

  171: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  172: 
  173: suite() ->
  174:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  175:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  176: 
  177: all() -> 
  178:     Groups = [{counters,  "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_COUNTERS",  include},
  179:               {chunks,    "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_CHUNKS",    include},
  180:               {ping_pong, "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_PING_PONG", include}],
  181:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  182: 
  183: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  184:     [];
  185: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  186:     [{group, Group}];
  187: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  188: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  189: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  190: 		[{group, Group}];
  191: 	    false ->
  192: 		[];
  193: 	    Val ->
  194: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  195: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  196: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  197: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  198: 			[{group, Group}];
  199: 		    _ ->
  200: 			[]
  201: 		end
  202: 	end.
  203:     
  204: 
  205: groups() -> 
  206:     [{counters,            [], traffic_counters_cases()},
  207:      {chunks,              [], traffic_chunks_cases()},
  208:      {ping_pong,           [], traffic_ping_pong_cases()},
  209:      {pp_send_recv,        [], traffic_pp_send_recv_cases()},
  210:      {pp_sendto_recvfrom,  [], traffic_pp_sendto_recvfrom_cases()},
  211:      {pp_sendmsg_recvmsg,  [], traffic_pp_sendmsg_recvmsg_cases()}
  212:     ].
  213:

  309: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  310:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  311:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  312:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  313:     
  314:     try socket:info() of
  315:         #{} ->
  316:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  317:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  318:                     SKIP;
  319: 
  320:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  321: 
  322:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  323:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  324: 
  325:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  326:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  327: 
  328:                     socket:use_registry(false),
  329:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
  330:                         default ->
  331:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
  332:                                 ok ->
  333:                                     Config1;
  334:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  335:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  336:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  337:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  338:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  339:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  340:                             end;
  341:                         Quiet ->
  342:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
  343:                                 ok ->
  344:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
  345:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  346:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  347:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  348:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  349:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  350:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  351:                             end
  352:                     end
  353:             end
  354:     catch
  355:         error : notsup ->
  356:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  357:         error : undef ->
  358:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  359:     end.
  360: 
  361: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  362: 
  363:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  364:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  365:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  366: 
  367:     %% Stop the local monitor
  368:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  369: 
  370:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
  371: 
  372:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  373: 
  374:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  375:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  376: 
  377:     Config1.
  378: 
  379: 
  380: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  381:     Config.
  382: 
  383: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  384:     Config.
  385: 
  386: 
  387: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  388:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  389:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  390:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
  391:     Config.
  392: 
  393: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  394:     Config.
  395: 
  396: 
  397: quiet_mode(Config) ->
  398:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
  399:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
  400:             Quiet;
  401:         false ->
  402:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
  403:                 "true"  -> true;
  404:                 "false" -> false;
  405:                 _       -> default
  406:             end
  407:     end.
  408: 
  409: 
  410: 
  411: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  412: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  413: %% for both read and write.
  414: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  415: %% We use TCP on IPv4.
  416: 
  417: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  418:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  419:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp4,
  420:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
  421:            fun() ->
  422:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  423:                                  proto  => tcp,
  424:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  425:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  426:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  427:            end).
  428: 
  429: 
  430: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  431: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  432: %% for both read and write.
  433: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  434: %% We use TCP on IPv6.
  435: 
  436: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  437:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  438:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp6,
  439:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
  440:            fun() ->
  441:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
  442:                                  proto  => tcp,
  443:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  444:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  445:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  446:            end).
  447: 
  448: 
  449: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  450: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  451: %% for both read and write.
  452: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  453: %% We use default (TCP) on local.
  454: 
  455: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  456:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  457:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcpL,
  458:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
  459:            fun() ->
  460:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
  461:                                  proto  => default,
  462:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  463:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  464:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  465:            end).
  466: 
  467: 
  468: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  469: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  470: %% for both read and write.
  471: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  472: %% We use SCTP on IPv4.
  473: 
  474: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_sctp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  475:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  476:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  477:            fun() ->
  478:                    has_support_ipv4(),
  479:                    has_support_sctp()
  480:            end,
  481:            fun() ->
  482:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  483:                                  proto  => sctp,
  484:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  485:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  486:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  487:            end).
  488: 
  489:

  520:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  521:            fun() ->
  522:                    is_not_windows(),
  523:                    has_support_ipv4()
  524:            end,
  525:            fun() ->
  526:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  527:                                  proto  => tcp,
  528:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
  529:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of
  530:                                                        {ok, #{iov  := [Data]}} ->
  531:                                                            {ok, Data};
  532:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
  533:                                                            ERROR
  534:                                                    end
  535:                                            end,
  536:                                  send   => fun(S, Data) ->
  537:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
  538:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
  539:                                            end},
  540:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  541:            end).

  586:            fun() ->
  587:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
  588:                                  proto  => default,

  590:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of

  598:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},

  649:                    has_support_ipv6(),
  650:                    has_support_sctp()

  654:                                  proto  => sctp,

  656:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of

  658:                                                            {ok, Data};
  659:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
  660:                                                            ERROR
  661:                                                    end
  662:                                            end,

  664:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},

  668:            end).
  669: 
  670: 
  671: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  672: 
  673: traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState) ->
  674:     ServerSeq =
  675:         [
  676:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
  677:          #{desc => "await start",
  678:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
  679:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
  680:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
  681:                    end},
  682:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
  683:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  684:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
  685:                            ok
  686:                    end},
  687: 
  688:          %% *** Init part ***
  689:          #{desc => "which local address",
  690:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
  691:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
  692:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
  693:                    end},
  694:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
  695:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
  696:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
  697:                                {ok, Sock} ->
  698:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
  699:                                {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
  700:                                    {skip, Reason};
  701:                                {error, eprotonosupport = Reason} ->
  702:                                    {skip, Reason};
  703:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  704:                                    ERROR
  705:                            end
  706:                    end},
  707:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
  708:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
  709:                          lsock    := LSock,
  710:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
  711:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
  712:                                ok ->
  713:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
  714:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  715:                                    ERROR
  716:                            end;
  717:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
  718:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
  719:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
  720:                                ok ->
  721:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
  722:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
  723:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  724:                                    ERROR
  725:                            end
  726:                    end},
  727:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
  728:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
  729:                            socket:listen(LSock)
  730:                    end},
  731:          #{desc => "initial (listen socket) counter validation (=zero)",
  732:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = _State) ->
  733:                            try socket:info(LSock) of
  734:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  735:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial listen socket counters: "
  736:                                                "~s", [format_counters(listen,
  737:                                                                       Counters)]),
  738:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
  739:                            catch
  740:                                C:E:S ->
  741:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  742:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  743:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  744:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  745:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  746:                            end
  747:                    end},
  748:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
  749:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
  750:                          tester   := Tester,
  751:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}}) ->
  752:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
  753:                            ok;
  754:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
  755:                          lport    := Port}) ->
  756:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
  757:                            ok
  758:                    end},
  759: 
  760:          %% The actual test
  761:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
  762:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  763:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
  764:                    end},
  765:          #{desc => "accept",
  766:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
  767:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
  768:                                {ok, CSock} ->
  769:                                    #{counters := LCnts} = socket:info(LSock),
  770:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate listen counters: "
  771:                                                "~s", [format_counters(listen,
  772:                                                                       LCnts)]),
  773:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  774:                                      LCnts,
  775:                                      [{acc_success, 1},
  776:                                       {acc_fails,   0},
  777:                                       {acc_tries,   1},
  778:                                       {acc_waits,   0}]),
  779:                                    #{counters := CCnts} = socket:info(CSock),
  780:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial accept counters: "
  781:                                                "~s", [format_counters(CCnts)]),
  782:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(CCnts),
  783:                                    {ok, State#{csock => CSock}};
  784:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  785:                                    ERROR
  786:                            end
  787:                    end},
  788:          #{desc => "initial counter validation (=zero)",
  789:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = _State) ->
  790:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  791:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  792:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial counters: "
  793:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  794:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
  795:                            catch
  796:                                C:E:S ->
  797:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  798:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  799:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  800:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  801:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  802:                            end
  803:                    end},
  804:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
  805:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  806:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
  807:                            ok
  808:                    end},
  809: 
  810:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
  811:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  812:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
  813:                    end},
  814:          #{desc => "recv (1)",
  815:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock,
  816:                          recv  := Recv} = State) ->
  817:                            case Recv(Sock) of
  818:                                {ok, Data} ->
  819:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  820:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => 1,
  821:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
  822:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  823:                                    ERROR
  824:                            end
  825:                    end},
  826:          #{desc => "validate (recv 1)",
  827:            cmd  => fun(#{csock     := Sock,
  828:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
  829:                          read_byte := Byte} = _State) ->
  830:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  831:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  832:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  833:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  834:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  835:                                      Counters,
  836:                                      [{read_pkg,     Pkg},
  837:                                       {read_byte,    Byte},
  838:                                       {read_tries,   any},
  839:                                       {read_pkg_max, any}])
  840:                            catch
  841:                                C:E:S ->
  842:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  843:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  844:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  845:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  846:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  847:                            end
  848:                    end},
  849:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
  850:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  851:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
  852:                            ok
  853:                    end},
  854: 
  855:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 1)",
  856:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  857:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
  858:                    end},
  859:          #{desc => "send (1)",
  860:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock,
  861:                          send  := Send} = State) ->
  862:                            Data = ?DATA,
  863:                            case Send(Sock, Data) of
  864:                                ok ->
  865:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  866:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => 1,
  867:                                                write_byte => size(Data)}};
  868:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  869:                                    ERROR
  870:                            end
  871:                    end},
  872:          #{desc => "validate (send 1)",
  873:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  874:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  875:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  876:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  877:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  878:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  879:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  880:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  881:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  882:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  883:                                      Counters,
  884:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  885:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  886:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  887:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  888:                                       {read_tries,    any},
  889:                                       {write_tries,   any},
  890:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
  891:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
  892:                            catch
  893:                                C:E:S ->
  894:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  895:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  896:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  897:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  898:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  899:                            end
  900:                    end},
  901:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 1)",
  902:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  903:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
  904:                            ok
  905:                    end},
  906: 
  907:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
  908:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  909:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
  910:                    end},
  911:          #{desc => "recv (2)",
  912:            cmd  => fun(#{csock     := Sock,
  913:                          recv      := Recv,
  914:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
  915:                          read_byte := Byte} = State) ->
  916:                            case Recv(Sock) of
  917:                                {ok, Data} ->
  918:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  919:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
  920:                                                read_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
  921:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  922:                                    ERROR
  923:                            end
  924:                    end},
  925:          #{desc => "validate (recv 2)",
  926:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  927:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  928:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  929:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  930:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  931:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  932:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  933:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  934:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  935:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  936:                                      Counters,
  937:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  938:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  939:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  940:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  941:                                       {read_tries,    any},
  942:                                       {write_tries,   any},
  943:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
  944:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
  945:                            catch
  946:                                C:E:S ->
  947:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  948:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  949:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  950:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  951:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  952:                            end
  953:                    end},
  954:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
  955:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  956:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
  957:                            ok
  958:                    end},
  959: 
  960:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 2)",
  961:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  962:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
  963:                    end},
  964:          #{desc => "send (2)",
  965:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  966:                          send       := Send,
  967:                          write_pkg  := Pkg,
  968:                          write_byte := Byte} = State) ->
  969:                            Data = ?DATA,
  970:                            case Send(Sock, Data) of
  971:                                ok ->
  972:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  973:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
  974:                                                write_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
  975:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  976:                                    ERROR
  977:                            end
  978:                    end},
  979:          #{desc => "validate (send 2)",
  980:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  981:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  982:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  983:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  984:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  985:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  986:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  987:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  988:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  989:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  990:                                      Counters,
  991:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  992:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  993:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  994:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  995:                                       {read_tries,    any},
  996:                                       {write_tries,   any},
  997:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
  998:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
  999:                            catch
 1000:                                C:E:S ->
 1001:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 1002:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1003:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1004:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),

 1530:                    end},
 1531:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 1532:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
 1533:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
 1534:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 1535:                            {ok, State1}
 1536:                    end},
 1537: 
 1538:          %% *** We are done ***
 1539:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1540:         ],
 1541: 
 1542:     i("start server evaluator"),
 1543:     ServerInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 1544:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 1545: 
 1546:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 1547:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 1548:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 1549: 
 1550:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 1551:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 1552:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
 1553:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1554: 
 1555:     i("await evaluator"),
 1556:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
 1557: 
 1558: 
 1559: format_counters(Counters) ->
 1560:     format_counters(traffic, Counters).
 1561: 
 1562: format_counters(Type, Counters) when (Type =:= listen) orelse (Type =:= traffic) ->
 1563:     format_counters("   ", Type, Counters).
 1564: 
 1565: format_counters(Prefix, traffic, Counters) ->
 1566:     ReadByte    = maps:get(read_byte,     Counters, -1),
 1567:     ReadFails   = maps:get(read_fails,    Counters, -1),
 1568:     ReadPkg     = maps:get(read_pkg,      Counters, -1),
 1569:     ReadPkgMax  = maps:get(read_pkg_max,  Counters, -1),
 1570:     ReadTries   = maps:get(read_tries,    Counters, -1),
 1571:     ReadWaits   = maps:get(read_waits,    Counters, -1),
 1572:     WriteByte   = maps:get(write_byte,    Counters, -1),
 1573:     WriteFails  = maps:get(write_fails,   Counters, -1),
 1574:     WritePkg    = maps:get(write_pkg,     Counters, -1),
 1575:     WritePkgMax = maps:get(write_pkg_max, Counters, -1),
 1576:     WriteTries  = maps:get(write_tries,   Counters, -1),
 1577:     WriteWaits  = maps:get(write_waits,   Counters, -1),
 1578:     ?F("~n~sNumber Of Read Bytes:     ~p"
 1579:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Fails:     ~p"
 1580:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Packages:  ~p"
 1581:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Tries:     ~p"
 1582:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Waits:     ~p"
 1583:        "~n~sMax Read Package Size:    ~p"
 1584:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Bytes:    ~p"
 1585:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Fails:    ~p"
 1586:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Packages: ~p"
 1587:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Tries:    ~p"
 1588:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Waits:    ~p"
 1589:        "~n~sMax Write Package Size:   ~p",
 1590:        [Prefix, ReadByte,
 1591:         Prefix, ReadFails,
 1592:         Prefix, ReadPkg,
 1593:         Prefix, ReadTries,
 1594:         Prefix, ReadWaits,
 1595:         Prefix, ReadPkgMax,
 1596:         Prefix, WriteByte,
 1597:         Prefix, WriteFails,
 1598:         Prefix, WritePkg,
 1599:         Prefix, WriteTries,
 1600:         Prefix, WriteWaits,
 1601:         Prefix, WritePkgMax]);
 1602: 
 1603: format_counters(Prefix, listen, Counters) ->
 1604:     AccSuccess = maps:get(acc_success, Counters, -1),
 1605:     AccFails   = maps:get(acc_fails,   Counters, -1),
 1606:     AccTries   = maps:get(acc_tries,   Counters, -1),
 1607:     AccWaits   = maps:get(acc_waits,   Counters, -1),
 1608:     ?F("~n~sNumber Of Successful Accepts: ~p"
 1609:        "~n~sNumber Of Failed Accepts:     ~p"
 1610:        "~n~sNumber Of Accept Attempts:    ~p"
 1611:        "~n~sNumber Of Accept Waits:       ~p",
 1612:        [Prefix, AccSuccess,
 1613:         Prefix, AccFails,
 1614:         Prefix, AccTries,
 1615:         Prefix, AccWaits]).
 1616: 
 1617: all_counters() ->
 1618:     [
 1619:      read_byte,
 1620:      read_fails,
 1621:      read_pkg,
 1622:      read_pkg_max,
 1623:      read_tries,
 1624:      read_waits,
 1625:      write_byte,
 1626:      write_fails,
 1627:      write_pkg,
 1628:      write_pkg_max,
 1629:      write_tries,
 1630:      write_waits,
 1631:      acc_success,
 1632:      acc_fails,
 1633:      acc_tries,
 1634:      acc_waits
 1635:     ].
 1636: 
 1637: zero_counters() ->
 1638:     [{Cnt, 0} || Cnt <- all_counters()].
 1639: 
 1640: any_counters() ->
 1641:     [{Cnt, any} || Cnt <- all_counters()].
 1642: 
 1643: 
 1644: %% This function ensures that we have a list of "validate counters"
 1645: %% that have an entry for each existing counter.
 1646: 
 1647: ensure_counters(Counters) ->
 1648:     ensure_counters(any_counters(), Counters, []).
 1649: 
 1650: ensure_counters([], [], Acc) ->
 1651:     lists:reverse(Acc);
 1652: ensure_counters([{Cnt, Val}|DefCounters], Counters, Acc) ->
 1653:     case lists:keysearch(Cnt, 1, Counters) of
 1654:         {value, {Cnt, _} = T} ->
 1655:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1656:             ensure_counters(DefCounters, Counters2, [T|Acc]);
 1657:         false ->
 1658:             ensure_counters(DefCounters, Counters, [{Cnt, Val}|Acc])
 1659:     end.
 1660: 
 1661: traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters) ->
 1662:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation -> entry with"
 1663:     %%             "~n   Counters: ~p", [Counters]),
 1664:     traffic_sar_counters_validation2(maps:to_list(Counters),
 1665:                                      zero_counters()).
 1666: 
 1667: traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters, ValidateCounters) ->
 1668:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation -> entry with"
 1669:     %%             "~n   Counters:          ~p"
 1670:     %%             "~n   Validate Counters: ~p", [Counters, ValidateCounters]),
 1671:     traffic_sar_counters_validation2(maps:to_list(Counters),
 1672:                                      ensure_counters(ValidateCounters)).
 1673: 
 1674: traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters, []) ->
 1675:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> Remaining Counters: "
 1676:     %%             "~n   ~p", [Counters]),
 1677:     (catch lists:foreach(
 1678:              fun({_Cnt, 0})   -> ok;
 1679:                 ({Cnt,  Val}) ->
 1680:                      throw({error, {invalid_counter, Cnt, Val}})
 1681:              end,
 1682:              Counters));
 1683: traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters, [{Cnt, Val}|ValidateCounters]) ->
 1684:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> try validate ~w when"
 1685:     %%             "~n   Counters:         ~p"
 1686:     %%             "~n   ValidateCounters: ~p", [Cnt, Counters, ValidateCounters]),
 1687:     case lists:keysearch(Cnt, 1, Counters) of
 1688:         {value, {Cnt, Val}} ->
 1689:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> ~w validated", [Cnt]),
 1690:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1691:             traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters2, ValidateCounters);
 1692:         {value, {Cnt, _Val}} when (Val =:= any) ->
 1693:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1694:             %%             "~w validated (any) when"
 1695:             %%             "~n   Counters: ~p", [Cnt, Counters]),
 1696:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1697:             traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters2, ValidateCounters);
 1698:         {value, {Cnt, InvVal}} ->
 1699:             ?SEV_EPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1700:                         "~w validation failed: "
 1701:                         "~n   Expected Value: ~p"
 1702:                         "~n   Actual Value:   ~p", [Cnt, Val, InvVal]),
 1703:             {error, {invalid_counter, Cnt, InvVal, Val}};
 1704:         false ->
 1705:             ?SEV_EPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1706:                         "~w validation failed: Unknown", [Cnt]),
 1707:             {error, {unknown_counter, Cnt, Counters}}
 1708:     end.
 1709:

 1718: traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1719:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
 1720:     tc_try(traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4,
 1721:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 1722:            fun() ->
 1723:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 1724:                                  proto  => udp,
 1725:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
 1726:                                                    socket:recvfrom(S)
 1727:                                            end,
 1728:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
 1729:                                                    socket:sendto(S, Data, Dest)
 1730:                                            end},
 1731:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
 1732:            end).

 1784: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1785: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test the counters
 1786: %% for both read and write.
 1787: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
 1788: %% We use UDP on IPv4.
 1789: 
 1790: traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1791:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),

 1793:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 1794:            fun() ->
 1795:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 1796:                                  proto  => udp,

 1799:                                                        {ok, #{addr  := Source,

 1803:                                                            ERROR
 1804:                                                    end
 1805:                                            end,
 1806:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
 1807:                                                    Msg = #{addr => Dest,
 1808:                                                               iov  => [Data]},
 1809:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
 1810:                                            end},
 1811:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
 1812:            end).

 1879: 
 1880: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1881: 
 1882: traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState) ->
 1883:     ServerSeq =
 1884:         [
 1885:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1886:          #{desc => "await start",
 1887:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1888:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1889:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1890:                    end},
 1891:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1892:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1893:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1894:                            ok
 1895:                    end},
 1896: 
 1897:          %% *** Init part ***
 1898:          #{desc => "which local address",
 1899:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 1900:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 1901:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 1902:                    end},
 1903:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1904:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
 1905:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
 1906:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1907:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1908:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1909:                                    ERROR
 1910:                            end
 1911:                    end},
 1912:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 1913:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 1914:                          sock     := Sock,
 1915:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 1916:                            case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 1917:                                ok ->
 1918:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 1919:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1920:                                    ERROR
 1921:                            end;
 1922:                       (#{sock     := LSock,
 1923:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 1924:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 1925:                                ok ->
 1926:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 1927:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 1928:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1929:                                    ERROR
 1930:                            end
 1931:                    end},
 1932:          #{desc => "initial counter validation (=zero)",
 1933:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1934:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 1935:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 1936:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial counters: "
 1937:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 1938:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
 1939:                            catch
 1940:                                C:E:S ->
 1941:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 1942:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1943:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1944:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1945:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 1946:                            end
 1947:                    end},
 1948:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1949:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 1950:                          tester   := Tester,
 1951:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}}) ->
 1952:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
 1953:                            ok;
 1954:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
 1955:                          lport    := Port}) ->
 1956:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
 1957:                            ok
 1958:                    end},
 1959: 
 1960:          %% The actual test
 1961:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
 1962:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1963:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
 1964:                    end},
 1965:          #{desc => "recv (1)",
 1966:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1967:                          recv := Recv} = State) ->
 1968:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 1969:                                {ok, {ClientSA, Data}} ->
 1970:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 1971:                                    {ok, State#{client_sa => ClientSA,
 1972:                                                read_pkg  => 1,
 1973:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
 1974:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1975:                                    ERROR
 1976:                            end
 1977:                    end},
 1978:          #{desc => "validate (recv 1)",
 1979:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 1980:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
 1981:                          read_byte := Byte} = _State) ->
 1982:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 1983:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 1984:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
 1985:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 1986:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
 1987:                                      Counters,
 1988:                                      [{read_pkg,   Pkg},
 1989:                                       {read_byte,  Byte},
 1990:                                       {read_tries, any}])
 1991:                            catch
 1992:                                C:E:S ->
 1993:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 1994:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1995:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1996:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1997:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 1998:                            end
 1999:                    end},
 2000:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2001:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2002:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
 2003:                            ok
 2004:                    end},
 2005: 
 2006:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 1)",
 2007:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2008:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
 2009:                    end},
 2010:          #{desc => "send (1)",
 2011:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 2012:                          send      := Send,
 2013:                          client_sa := ClientSA} = State) ->
 2014:                            Data = ?DATA,
 2015:                            case Send(Sock, Data, ClientSA) of
 2016:                                ok ->
 2017:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 2018:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => 1,
 2019:                                                write_byte => size(Data)}};
 2020:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2021:                                    ERROR
 2022:                            end
 2023:                    end},
 2024:          #{desc => "validate (send 1)",
 2025:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
 2026:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
 2027:                          read_byte  := RByte,
 2028:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
 2029:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
 2030:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 2031:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 2032:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
 2033:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 2034:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
 2035:                                      Counters,
 2036:                                      [{read_pkg,    RPkg},
 2037:                                       {read_byte,   RByte},
 2038:                                       {write_pkg,   SPkg},
 2039:                                       {write_byte,  SByte},
 2040:                                       {read_tries,  any},
 2041:                                       {write_tries, any}])
 2042:                            catch
 2043:                                C:E:S ->
 2044:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 2045:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 2046:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 2047:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 2048:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 2049:                            end
 2050:                    end},
 2051:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 1)",
 2052:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2053:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
 2054:                            ok
 2055:                    end},
 2056: 
 2057:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2058:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2059:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
 2060:                    end},
 2061:          #{desc => "recv (2)",
 2062:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 2063:                          recv      := Recv,
 2064:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
 2065:                          read_byte := Byte} = State) ->
 2066:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 2067:                                {ok, {Source, Data}} ->
 2068:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 2069:                                    {ok, State#{client_sa => Source,
 2070:                                                read_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
 2071:                                                read_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
 2072:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2073:                                    ERROR
 2074:                            end
 2075:                    end},
 2076:          #{desc => "validate (recv 2)",
 2077:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
 2078:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
 2079:                          read_byte  := RByte,
 2080:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
 2081:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
 2082:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 2083:                                #{counters := Counters} ->

 2591:                    end},
 2592:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2593:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2594:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_and_validate)
 2595:                    end},
 2596: 
 2597:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2598: 
 2599:          #{desc => "order client to continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2600:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2601:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, recv_and_validate),
 2602:                            ok
 2603:                    end},
 2604:          #{desc => "order server to continue (send_and_validate 1)",
 2605:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2606:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_and_validate),
 2607:                            ok
 2608:                    end},
 2609:          #{desc => "await server ready (send_and_validate 1)",
 2610:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2611:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_and_validate)
 2612:                    end},
 2613:          #{desc => "await client ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2614:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2615:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_and_validate)
 2616:                    end},
 2617: 
 2618:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2619: 
 2620:          #{desc => "order server to continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2621:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2622:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, recv_and_validate),
 2623:                            ok
 2624:                    end},
 2625:          #{desc => "order client to continue (send_and_validate 2)",
 2626:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2627:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_and_validate),
 2628:                            ok
 2629:                    end},
 2630:          #{desc => "await client ready (send_and_validate 2)",
 2631:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2632:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_and_validate)
 2633:                    end},
 2634:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2635:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2636:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_and_validate)
 2637:                    end},
 2638: 
 2639:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2640: 
 2641:          #{desc => "order client to continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2642:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2643:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, recv_and_validate),
 2644:                            ok
 2645:                    end},
 2646:          #{desc => "order server to continue (send_and_validate 2)",
 2647:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2648:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_and_validate),
 2649:                            ok
 2650:                    end},
 2651:          #{desc => "await server ready (send_and_validate 2)",
 2652:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2653:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_and_validate)
 2654:                    end},
 2655:          #{desc => "await client ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2656:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2657:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_and_validate)
 2658:                    end},
 2659: 
 2660:          %% *** Termination ***
 2661:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 2662:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2663:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
 2664:                            ok
 2665:                    end},
 2666:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 2667:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
 2668:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
 2669:                            State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
 2670:                            {ok, State1}
 2671:                    end},
 2672:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 2673:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2674:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
 2675:                            ok
 2676:                    end},
 2677:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 2678:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
 2679:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
 2680:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 2681:                            {ok, State1}
 2682:                    end},
 2683: 
 2684:          %% *** We are done ***
 2685:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2686:         ],
 2687: 
 2688:     i("start server evaluator"),
 2689:     ServerInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 2690:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 2691: 
 2692:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 2693:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 2694:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 2695: 
 2696:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 2697:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 2698:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
 2699:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2700: 
 2701:     i("await evaluator"),
 2702:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).

 2711: %% Second, send in a bunch of "small" chunks, and read in one "big" chunk.
 2712: %% Protocol is tcp and Domain is IPv4.
 2713: 
 2714: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2715:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 2716:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2717:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 2718:            fun() ->
 2719:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 2720:                                  proto  => tcp},
 2721:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState)
 2722:            end).

 2807: 
 2808: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState) ->
 2809:     ServerSeq =
 2810:         [
 2811:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2812:          #{desc => "await start",
 2813:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2814:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2815:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2816:                    end},
 2817:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2818:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2819:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2820:                            ok
 2821:                    end},
 2822: 
 2823:          %% *** Init part ***
 2824:          #{desc => "which local address",
 2825:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 2826:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 2827:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 2828:                    end},
 2829:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
 2830:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
 2831:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 2832:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2833:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 2834:                                {error, eprotonosupport = Reason} ->
 2835:                                    {skip, Reason};
 2836:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2837:                                    ERROR
 2838:                            end
 2839:                    end},
 2840:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 2841:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 2842:                          lsock    := LSock,
 2843:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 2844:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 2845:                                ok ->
 2846:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 2847:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2848:                                    ERROR
 2849:                            end;
 2850:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
 2851:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 2852:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 2853:                                ok ->
 2854:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 2855:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 2856:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2857:                                    ERROR
 2858:                            end
 2859:                    end},
 2860:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 2861:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 2862:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 2863:                    end},
 2864:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2865:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 2866:                          tester   := Tester,
 2867:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
 2868:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
 2869:                            ok;
 2870:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
 2871:                          local_sa := LSA,
 2872:                          lport    := Port}) ->
 2873:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 2874:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
 2875:                            ok
 2876:                    end},
 2877: 
 2878:          %% The actual test
 2879:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 2880:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2881:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 2882:                    end},
 2883:          #{desc => "accept",
 2884:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 2885:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 2886:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2887:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
 2888:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2889:                                    ERROR
 2890:                            end
 2891:                    end},
 2892:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
 2893:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2894:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 2895:                            ok
 2896:                    end},
 2897: 
 2898:          #{desc => "await continue (recv-many-small)",
 2899:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2900:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_many_small)
 2901:                    end},
 2902:          #{desc => "recv chunk 1",
 2903:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
 2904:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2905:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2906:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 1 of ~p bytes",
 2907:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2908:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)]}};
 2909:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2910:                                    ERROR
 2911:                            end
 2912:                    end},
 2913:          #{desc => "recv chunk 2",
 2914:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2915:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2916:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2917:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2918:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 2 of ~p bytes",
 2919:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2920:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2921:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2922:                                    ERROR
 2923:                            end
 2924:                    end},
 2925:          #{desc => "recv chunk 3",
 2926:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2927:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2928:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2929:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2930:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 3 of ~p bytes",
 2931:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2932:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2933:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2934:                                    ERROR
 2935:                            end
 2936:                    end},
 2937:          #{desc => "recv chunk 4",
 2938:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2939:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2940:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2941:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2942:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 4 of ~p bytes",
 2943:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2944:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2945:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2946:                                    ERROR
 2947:                            end
 2948:                    end},
 2949:          #{desc => "recv chunk 5",
 2950:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2951:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2952:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2953:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2954:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 5 of ~p bytes",
 2955:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2956:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2957:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2958:                                    ERROR
 2959:                            end
 2960:                    end},
 2961:          #{desc => "recv chunk 6",
 2962:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2963:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2964:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2965:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2966:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 6 of ~p bytes",
 2967:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2968:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2969:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2970:                                    ERROR
 2971:                            end
 2972:                    end},
 2973:          #{desc => "recv chunk 7",
 2974:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2975:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2976:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2977:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2978:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 7 of ~p bytes",
 2979:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2980:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2981:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2982:                                    ERROR
 2983:                            end
 2984:                    end},
 2985:          #{desc => "recv chunk 8",
 2986:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2987:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2988:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2989:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2990:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 8 of ~p bytes",
 2991:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2992:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2993:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2994:                                    ERROR
 2995:                            end
 2996:                    end},
 2997:          #{desc => "recv chunk 9",
 2998:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2999:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 3000:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 3001:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 3002:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 9 of ~p bytes",
 3003:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 3004:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 3005:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3006:                                    ERROR
 3007:                            end
 3008:                    end},
 3009:          #{desc => "recv chunk 10",
 3010:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 3011:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 3012:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 3013:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 3014:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 10 of ~p bytes",
 3015:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 3016:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 3017:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3018:                                    ERROR
 3019:                            end
 3020:                    end},
 3021:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv-many-small)",
 3022:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 3023:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 3024:                            Data = lists:flatten(lists:reverse(Chunks)),
 3025:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_many_small, Data),
 3026:                            {ok, maps:remove(chunks, State)}
 3027:                    end},
 3028: 
 3029:          #{desc => "await continue (recv-one-big)",
 3030:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3031:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_one_big) of
 3032:                                {ok, Size} ->
 3033:                                    {ok, State#{size => Size}};
 3034:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3035:                                    ERROR
 3036:                            end
 3037:                    end},
 3038:          #{desc => "recv (one big)",
 3039:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, csock := Sock, size := Size} = _State) ->
 3040:                            %% socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
 3041:                            case socket:recv(Sock, Size) of
 3042:                                {ok, Data} ->
 3043:                                    ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester,
 3044:                                                        recv_one_big,
 3045:                                                        b2l(Data)),
 3046:                                    ok;
 3047:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3048:                                    ERROR
 3049:                            end
 3050:                    end},
 3051: 
 3052:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3053:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3054:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3055:                                ok ->
 3056:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3057:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3058:                                    ERROR
 3059:                            end
 3060:                    end},
 3061:          #{desc => "close connection socket (just in case)",
 3062:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
 3063:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 3064:                            {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)}
 3065:                    end},
 3066:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 3067:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 3068:                          lsock    := Sock,
 3069:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 3070:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 3071:                            State1 =
 3072:                                unlink_path(Path,
 3073:                                            fun() ->
 3074:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 3075:                                            end,
 3076:                                            fun() -> State end),
 3077:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
 3078:                       (#{lsock := Sock} = State) ->
 3079:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 3080:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)}
 3081:                    end},
 3082: 
 3083:          %% *** We are done ***
 3084:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3085:         ],
 3086: 
 3087:     ClientSeq =
 3088:         [
 3089:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3090:          #{desc => "await start",
 3091:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3092:                            {Tester, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3093:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester,
 3094:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
 3095:                    end},
 3096:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3097:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3098:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3099:                            ok
 3100:                    end},
 3101: 
 3102:          %% *** Init part ***
 3103:          #{desc => "create node",
 3104:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3105:                            {Peer, Node} = start_node("client"),
 3106:                            {ok, State#{peer => Peer, node => Node}}
 3107:                    end},
 3108:          #{desc => "monitor client node",
 3109:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
 3110:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 3111:                            ok
 3112:                    end},
 3113:          #{desc => "start remote client",
 3114:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 3115:                            Pid = traffic_snr_tcp_client_start(Node),
 3116:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
 3117:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
 3118:                    end},
 3119:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
 3120:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
 3121:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 3122:                            ok
 3123:                    end},
 3124:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
 3125:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
 3126:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 3127:                          proto     := Proto}) ->
