 6342:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Pid}) ->
 6343:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6344:                            ok
 6345:                    end},
 6346:          #{desc => "order remote handler to start",
 6347:            cmd  => fun(#{handler   := Handler,
 6348:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 6349:                          proto     := Proto,
 6350:                          buf_init  := BufInit,
 6351:                          send      := Send,
 6352:                          recv      := Recv}) ->
 6353:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Handler, 
 6354:                                                {ServerSA, Proto, BufInit,
 6355:                                                 Send, Recv}),
 6356:                            ok
 6357:                    end},
 6358:          #{desc => "await (remote) handler ready",
 6359:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 6360:                          handler := Handler} = _State) ->
 6361:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler, handler, init, 
 6362:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 6363:                    end},
 6364:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6365:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6366:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 6367:                            ok
 6368:                    end},
 6369: 
 6370:          %% The actual test
 6371:          #{desc => "await continue (send)",
 6372:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 6373:                          handler := Handler} = _State) ->
 6374:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, 
 6375:                                                send, 
 6376:                                                [{handler, Handler}])
 6377:                    end},
 6378:          #{desc => "order handler to continue (send)",
 6379:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Handler,
 6380:                          msg     := Msg,
 6381:                          num     := Num} = State) ->
 6382:                            Data = {Msg, Num},
 6383:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, send, Data),
 6384:                            {ok, maps:remove(data, State)}
 6385:                    end},
 6386:          #{desc => "await remote handler ready (send)",
 6387:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 6388:                          handler := Handler} = State) ->
 6389:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler, handler, send, 
 6390:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
 6391:                                {ok, Result} ->
 6392:                                    %% ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client result: "
 6393:                                    %%             "~n   ~p", [Result]),
 6394:                                    {ok, State#{result => Result}};
 6395:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6396:                                    ERROR
 6397:                            end
 6398:                    end},
 6399:          #{desc => "announce ready (send)",
 6400:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, result := Result} = State) ->
 6401:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send, Result),
 6402:                            {ok, maps:remove(result, State)}
 6403:                    end},
 6404: 
 6405:          %% Termination
 6406:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6407:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
 6408:                          handler := Handler} = State) ->
 6409:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 6410:                                                      [{handler, Handler}]) of
 6411:                                ok ->
 6412:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6413:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6414:                                    ERROR
 6415:                            end
 6416:                    end},
 6417:          #{desc => "stop (remote) handler",
 6418:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Handler}) ->
 6419:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Handler),
 6420:                            ok
 6421:                    end},
 6422:          #{desc => "await (remote) handler termination",
 6423:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Handler} = State) ->
 6424:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Handler),
 6425:                            State1 = maps:remove(handler, State),
 6426:                            {ok, State1}
 6427:                    end},
 6428:          #{desc => "stop client node",
 6429:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
 6430:                            {ok,
 6431:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 6432:                                 ok ->
 6433:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 6434:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 6435:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 6436:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6437:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 6438:                             catch
 6439:                                 C:E:S ->
 6440:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 6441:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 6442:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 6443:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 6444:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 6445:                             end}
 6446:                    end},
 6447:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
 6448:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 6449:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown"),
 6450:                            receive
 6451:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 6452:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 6453:                                    State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 6454:                                    {ok, State1}
 6455:                            end;
 6456:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 6457:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 6458:                            State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 6459:                            {ok, State1}
 6460:                    end},
 6461: 
 6462:          %% *** We are done ***
 6463:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6464:         ],
 6465: 
 6466:     TesterSeq =
 6467:         [
 6468:          %% *** Init part ***
 6469:          #{desc => "monitor server",
 6470:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6471:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6472:                            ok
 6473:                    end},
 6474:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 6475:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6476:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6477:                            ok
 6478:                    end},
 6479: 
 6480:          %% Start the server
 6481:          #{desc => "order server start",
 6482:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6483:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6484:                            ok
 6485:                    end},
 6486:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
 6487:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 6488:                            {ok, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
 6489:                            {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}}
 6490:                    end},
 6491: 
 6492:          %% Start the client
 6493:          #{desc => "order client start",
 6494:            cmd  => fun(#{client    := Pid, 
 6495:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 6496:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, ServerSA),
 6497:                            ok
 6498:                    end},
 6499:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
 6500:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6501:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 6502:                    end},
 6503:  
 6504:          %% The actual test
 6505:          #{desc => "order server continue (recv)",
 6506:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6507:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 6508:                            ok
 6509:                    end},
 6510:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 6511:          #{desc => "order client continue (send)",
 6512:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6513:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, send),
 6514:                            ok
 6515:                    end},
 6516:          #{desc => "await client ready (send)",
 6517:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 6518:                          client := Client} = State) ->
 6519:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send, 
 6520:                                                  [{server, Server}]) of
 6521:                                {ok, {_, _, _, _} = Result} ->
 6522:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("client result: "
 6523:                                                "~n   ~p", [Result]),
 6524:                                    {ok, State#{client_result => Result}};
 6525:                                {ok, BadResult} ->
 6526:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("client result: "
 6527:                                                "~n   ~p", [BadResult]),
 6528:                                    {error, {invalid_client_result, BadResult}};
 6529:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6530:                                    ERROR
 6531:                            end
 6532:                    end},
 6533:          #{desc => "order server continue (close)",
 6534:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6535:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 6536:                            ok
 6537:                    end},
 6538:          #{desc => "await server ready (close)",
 6539:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6540:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, close)
 6541:                    end},
 6542:          %% Because of the way we control the server, there is no real 
 6543:          %% point in collecting statistics from it (the time will include
 6544:          %% our communication with it).
 6545:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv)",
 6546:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 6547:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 6548:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv,
 6549:                                                  [{client, Client}]) of
 6550:                                {ok, _Result} ->
 6551:                                    ok;
 6552:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6553:                                    ERROR
 6554:                            end
 6555:                    end},
 6556:          #{desc => "present result",
 6557:            cmd  => fun(#{client_result := CRes,
 6558:                          num           := Num} = State) ->
 6559:                            {CSent, CReceived, CStart, CStop} = CRes,
 6560:                            CTime = tdiff(CStart, CStop),
 6561:                            if
 6562:                                (CTime =:= 0) ->
 6563:                                    {skip,
 6564:                                     ?F("Invalid exec time: ~w ", [CTime])};
 6565:                                true ->
 6566:                                    %% Note that the sizes we are counting is
 6567:                                    %% only the "data" part of the messages.
 6568:                                    %% There is also fixed header for each
 6569:                                    %% message, which of course is small for
 6570:                                    %% the large messages, but comparatively
 6571:                                    %% big for the small messages!
 6572:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT(
 6573:                                       "Results: ~w messages exchanged"
 6574:                                       "~n   Client: ~w msec"
 6575:                                       "~n      ~.2f msec/message (roundtrip)"
 6576:                                       "~n      ~.2f messages/msec (roundtrip)"
 6577:                                       "~n      ~w bytes/msec sent"
 6578:                                       "~n      ~w bytes/msec received",
 6579:                                       [Num,
 6580:                                        CTime,
 6581:                                        CTime / Num,
 6582:                                        Num / CTime,
 6583:                                        CSent div CTime,
 6584:                                        CReceived div CTime]),
 6585:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client_result, State),
 6586:                                    {ok, State1}
 6587:                            end
 6588:                    end},
 6589: 
 6590:          %% Terminations
 6591:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 6592:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6593:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6594:                            ok
 6595:                    end},
 6596:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 6597:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 6598:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6599:                                ok ->
 6600:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
 6601:                                    {ok, State1};
 6602:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6603:                                    ERROR
 6604:                            end
 6605:                    end},
 6606:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 6607:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6608:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6609:                            ok
 6610:                    end},
 6611:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 6612:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 6613:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6614:                                ok ->
 6615:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 6616:                                    {ok, State1};
 6617:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6618:                                    ERROR
 6619:                            end
 6620:                    end},
 6621: 
 6622: 
 6623:          %% *** We are done ***
 6624:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6625:         ],
 6626: 
 6627: 
 6628:     i("start server evaluator"),
 6629:     ServerInitState = #{domain   => maps:get(domain,   InitState),
 6630:                         proto    => maps:get(proto,    InitState),
 6631:                         recv     => maps:get(recv,     InitState),
 6632:                         send     => maps:get(send,     InitState),
 6633:                         buf_init => maps:get(buf_init, InitState)},
 6634:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 6635: 
 6636:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 6637:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 6638:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 6639: 
 6640:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 6641:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 6642:                         client => Client#ev.pid,
 6643:                         num    => maps:get(num, InitState)},
 6644:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6645: 
 6646:     i("await evaluator"),
 6647:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
 6648: 
 6649: 
 6650: 
 6651: %% Server side handler process
 6652: %% We don't actually need a separate process for this socket, 
 6653: %% but we do it anyway to simplify the sequence.
 6654: tpp_udp_server_handler_create() ->
 6655:     Self = self(),
 6656:     erlang:spawn(fun() -> tpp_udp_server_handler(Self) end).
 6657: 
 6658: tpp_udp_server_handler(Parent) ->
 6659:     tpp_udp_server_handler_init(Parent),
 6660:     {Sock, Send, Recv} = tpp_udp_handler_await_start(Parent),
 6661:     tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 6662:     tpp_udp_handler_await_continue(Parent, recv),
 6663:     Result = tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange(Sock, Send, Recv),
 6664:     tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, Result),
 6665:     Reason = tpp_udp_handler_await_terminate(Parent),
 6666:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminating"),
 6667:     exit(Reason).
 6668: 
 6669: tpp_udp_server_handler_init(Parent) ->
 6670:     put(sname, "shandler"),
 6671:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 6672:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 6673:     ok.
 6674: 
 6675: tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange(Sock, Send, Recv) ->
 6676:     tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Send, Recv,
 6677:                                              0, 0, 0, undefined).
 6678: 
 6679: tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Send, Recv, 
 6680:                                          N, Sent, Received, Start) ->
 6681:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("[~w] try receive", [N]),
 6682:     %% if 
 6683:     %%     (N =:= (?TPP_SMALL_NUM-2)) -> 
 6684:     %%         ?SEV_IPRINT("[~w] try receive", [N]),
 6685:     %%         socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true); 
 6686:     %%     true -> ok
 6687:     %% end,
 6688:     try tpp_udp_recv_req(Sock, Recv) of
 6689:         {ok, Msg, RecvSz, From} ->
 6690:             NewStart = if (Start =:= undefined) -> ?SLIB:timestamp(); 
 6691:                           true -> Start end,
 6692:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("[~w] received - now try send", [N]),
 6693:             try tpp_udp_send_rep(Sock, Send, Msg, From) of
 6694:                 {ok, SendSz} ->
 6695:                     tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Send, Recv,
 6696:                                                              N+1,
 6697:                                                              Sent+SendSz,
 6698:                                                              Received+RecvSz,
 6699:                                                              NewStart);
 6700:                 {error, SReason} ->
 6701:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("send (~w): ~p", [N, SReason]),
 6702:                     exit({send, SReason, N})
 6703: 	    catch
 6704: 		SC:SE:SS ->
 6705: 		    exit({send, {SC, SE, SS}, N})
 6706:             end;
 6707:         {error, closed} ->
 6708:             ?SEV_IPRINT("closed - we are done: ~w, ~w, ~w",
 6709:                         [N, Sent, Received]),
 6710:             Stop = ?SLIB:timestamp(),
 6711:             {N, Sent, Received, Start, Stop};
 6712:         {error, RReason} ->
 6713:             ?SEV_EPRINT("recv (~w): ~p", [N, RReason]),
 6714:             exit({recv, RReason, N})
 6715:     catch
 6716: 	RC:RE:RS ->
 6717: 	    exit({recv, {RC, RE, RS}, N})	
 6718:     end.
 6719:   
 6720: 
 6721: %% The (remote) client side handler process
 6722: 
 6723: tpp_udp_client_handler_create(Node) ->
 6724:     Self = self(),
 6725:     Fun  = fun() -> put(sname, "chandler"), tpp_udp_client_handler(Self) end,
 6726:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
 6727: 
 6728: tpp_udp_client_handler(Parent) ->
 6729:     tpp_udp_client_handler_init(Parent),
 6730:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await start command"),
 6731:     {ServerSA, Proto, BufInit, Send, Recv} = tpp_udp_handler_await_start(Parent),
 6732:     ?SEV_IPRINT("start command with"
 6733:                 "~n   ServerSA: ~p", [ServerSA]),
 6734:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
 6735:     Sock     = tpp_udp_sock_open(Domain, Proto, BufInit),
 6736:     Path     = tpp_udp_sock_bind(Sock, Domain),
 6737:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready", []),
 6738:     tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 6739:     {InitMsg, Num} = tpp_udp_handler_await_continue(Parent, send),
 6740:     ?SEV_IPRINT("received continue with"
 6741:                 "~n   Num: ~p", [Num]),
 6742:     Result = tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange(Sock, ServerSA, 
 6743:                                                  Send, Recv, InitMsg, Num),
 6744:     ?SEV_IPRINT("ready"),
 6745:     tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, send, Result),
 6746:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 6747:     Reason = tpp_udp_handler_await_terminate(Parent),
 6748:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate with ~p", [Reason]),
 6749:     tpp_udp_sock_close(Sock, Path),
 6750:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminating"),
 6751:     exit(Reason).
 6752: 
 6753: tpp_udp_client_handler_init(Parent) ->
 6754:     put(sname, "chandler"),
 6755:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 6756:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 6757:     ok.
 6758: 
 6759: tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange(Sock, ServerSA,
 6760:                                     Send, Recv, InitMsg, Num) ->
 6761:     Start = ?SLIB:timestamp(),
 6762:     tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, ServerSA,
 6763:                                              Send, Recv, InitMsg,
 6764:                                              Num, 0, 0, 0, Start).
 6765: 
 6766: tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(_Sock, _Dest, _Send, _Recv, _Msg,
 6767:                                          Num, Num, Sent, Received,
 6768:                                          Start) ->
 6769:     Stop = ?SLIB:timestamp(),
 6770:     {Sent, Received, Start, Stop};
 6771: tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock,
 6772: 					 #{family := local} = Dest,
 6773: 					 Send, Recv, Data,
 6774:                                          Num, N, Sent, Received, Start) ->
 6775:     case tpp_udp_send_req(Sock, Send, Data, Dest) of
 6776:         {ok, SendSz} ->
 6777:             case tpp_udp_recv_rep(Sock, Recv) of
 6778:                 {ok, NewData, RecvSz, Dest} ->
 6779:                     tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Dest,
 6780:                                                              Send, Recv,
 6781:                                                              NewData, Num, N+1,
 6782:                                                              Sent+SendSz, 
 6783:                                                              Received+RecvSz, 
 6784:                                                              Start);
 6785:                 {error, RReason} ->
 6786:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("recv (~w of ~w): ~p", [N, Num, RReason]),
 6787:                     exit({recv, RReason, N})
 6788:             end;
 6789:         {error, SReason} ->
 6790:             ?SEV_EPRINT("send (~w of ~w): ~p", [N, Num, SReason]),
 6791:             exit({send, SReason, N})
 6792:     end;
 6793: tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock,
 6794: 					 #{addr := Addr, port := Port} = Dest0,
 6795: 					 Send, Recv, Data,
 6796:                                          Num, N, Sent, Received, Start) ->
 6797:     case tpp_udp_send_req(Sock, Send, Data, Dest0) of
 6798:         {ok, SendSz} ->
 6799:             case tpp_udp_recv_rep(Sock, Recv) of
 6800:                 {ok, NewData, RecvSz, #{addr := Addr, port := Port} = Dest1} ->
 6801:                     tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Dest1,
 6802:                                                              Send, Recv,
 6803:                                                              NewData, Num, N+1,
 6804:                                                              Sent+SendSz, 
 6805:                                                              Received+RecvSz, 
 6806:                                                              Start);
 6807:                 {error, RReason} ->
 6808:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("recv (~w of ~w): ~p", [N, Num, RReason]),
 6809:                     exit({recv, RReason, N})
 6810:             end;
 6811:         {error, SReason} ->
 6812:             ?SEV_EPRINT("send (~w of ~w): ~p", [N, Num, SReason]),
 6813:             exit({send, SReason, N})
 6814:     end.
 6815: 
 6816: 
 6817: tpp_udp_recv_req(Sock, Recv) ->
 6818:     tpp_udp_recv(Sock, Recv, ?TPP_REQUEST).
 6819: 
 6820: tpp_udp_recv_rep(Sock, Recv) ->
 6821:     tpp_udp_recv(Sock, Recv, ?TPP_REPLY).
 6822: 
 6823: tpp_udp_recv(Sock, Recv, Tag) ->
 6824:     %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
 6825:     try Recv(Sock, 0) of
 6826:         {ok, {Source, <<Tag:32/integer, Sz:32/integer, Data/binary>> = Msg}} 
 6827:           when (Sz =:= size(Data)) ->
 6828: 	    %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
 6829:             %% We got it all
 6830:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("tpp_udp_recv -> got all: "
 6831:             %%             "~n   Source:     ~p"
 6832:             %%             "~n   Tag:        ~p"
 6833:             %%             "~n   Sz:         ~p"
 6834:             %%             "~n   size(Data): ~p",
 6835:             %%             [Source, Tag, Sz, size(Data)]),
 6836:             {ok, Data, size(Msg), Source};
 6837:         {ok, {_Source, <<Tag:32/integer, Sz:32/integer, Data/binary>>}} ->
 6838: 	    %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
 6839:             {error, {invalid_msg, Sz, size(Data)}};
 6840:         {ok, {_, <<Tag:32/integer, _/binary>>}} ->
 6841: 	    %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
 6842:             {error, {invalid_msg_tag, Tag}};
 6843:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6844: 	    %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
 6845:             ERROR
 6846:     catch
 6847: 	C:E:S ->
 6848: 	    {error, {caught, C, E, S}}
 6849:     end.
 6850: 
 6851: tpp_udp_send_req(Sock, Send, Data, Dest) ->
 6852:     tpp_udp_send(Sock, Send, ?TPP_REQUEST, Data, Dest).
 6853: 
 6854: tpp_udp_send_rep(Sock, Send, Data, Dest) ->
 6855:     tpp_udp_send(Sock, Send, ?TPP_REPLY, Data, Dest).
 6856: 
 6857: tpp_udp_send(Sock, Send, Tag, Data, Dest) ->
 6858:     DataSz = size(Data),
 6859:     Msg    = <<Tag:32/integer, DataSz:32/integer, Data/binary>>,
 6860:     tpp_udp_send_msg(Sock, Send, Msg, Dest, 0).
 6861: 
 6862: tpp_udp_send_msg(Sock, Send, Msg, Dest, AccSz) when is_binary(Msg) ->
 6863:     case Send(Sock, Msg, Dest) of
 6864:         ok ->
 6865:             {ok, AccSz+size(Msg)};
 6866:         {ok, Rest} -> % This is an IOVec
 6867:             RestBin = list_to_binary(Rest),
 6868:             tpp_udp_send_msg(Sock, Send, RestBin, Dest,
 6869:                              AccSz+(size(Msg)-size(RestBin)));
 6870:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6871:             ERROR
 6872:     end.
 6873:     
 6874: 
 6875: tpp_udp_handler_await_start(Parent) ->
 6876:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await start"),
 6877:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
 6878: 
 6879: tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
 6880:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready (~p)", [Slogan]),
 6881:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
 6882: tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Extra) ->
 6883:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready (~p)", [Slogan]),
 6884:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Extra).
 6885: 
 6886: tpp_udp_handler_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
 6887:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await continue (~p)", [Slogan]),
 6888:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan) of
 6889:         ok ->
 6890:             ?SEV_IPRINT("continue (~p): ok", [Slogan]),
 6891:             ok;
 6892:         {ok, Data} ->
 6893:             ?SEV_IPRINT("continue (~p): ok with data", [Slogan]),
 6894:             Data;
 6895:         {error, Reason} ->
 6896:             ?SEV_EPRINT("continue (~p): error"
 6897:                         "~n   ~p", [Slogan, Reason]),
 6898:             exit({continue, Slogan, Reason})
 6899:     end.
 6900: 
 6901: tpp_udp_handler_await_terminate(Parent) ->
 6902:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 6903:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
 6904:         ok ->
 6905:             ok;
 6906:         {error, Reason} ->
 6907:             Reason
 6908:     end.
 6909: 
 6910: 
 6911: tpp_udp_sock_open(Domain, Proto, BufInit) ->
 6912:     case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
 6913:         {ok, Sock} ->
 6914:             ok = BufInit(Sock),
 6915:             Sock;
 6916:         {error, Reason} ->
 6917:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
 6918:     end.
 6919: 
 6920: tpp_udp_sock_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
 6921:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6922:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 6923:         ok ->
 6924:             ok;
 6925:         {error, Reason} ->
 6926:             exit({bind, Reason})
 6927:     end.
 6928: 
 6929: tpp_udp_sock_close(Sock, Path) ->
 6930:     case socket:close(Sock) of
 6931:         ok ->
 6932:             unlink_path(Path),
 6933:             ok;
 6934:         {error, Reason} ->
 6935:             ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed closing socket: "
 6936:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6937:             unlink_path(Path),
 6938:             {error, {close, Reason}}
 6939:     end.
 6940: 
 6941: 
 6942: 
 6943: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6944: 
 6945: sock_bind(Sock, LSA) ->
 6946:     try socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 6947:         ok = OK ->
 6948:             OK;
 6949:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 6950:             ?SEV_IPRINT("Address not available"),
 6951:             throw({skip, Reason});
 6952:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6953:             ERROR
 6954:     catch
 6955:         C:E:S ->
 6956:             ?FAIL({bind, C, E, S})
 6957:     end.
 6958: 
 6959: 
 6960: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6961: 
 6962: local_host() ->
 6963:     try net_adm:localhost() of
 6964:         Host when is_list(Host) ->
 6965: 	    %% Convert to shortname if long
 6966: 	    case string:tokens(Host, [$.]) of
 6967: 		[H|_] ->
 6968: 		    list_to_atom(H)
 6969: 	    end
 6970:     catch
 6971:         C:E:S ->
 6972:             erlang:raise(C, E, S)
 6973:     end.
 6974: 
 6975: 
 6976: %% The point of this is to "ensure" that paths from different test runs
 6977: %% don't clash.
 6978: 
 6979: mk_unique_path() ->
 6980:     ?SLIB:mk_unique_path().
 6981: 
 6982: 
 6983: which_local_socket_addr(local = Domain) ->
 6984:     #{family => Domain,
 6985:       path   => mk_unique_path()};
 6986: 
 6987: %% This gets the local socket address (not 127.0...)
 6988: %% We should really implement this using the (new) net module,
 6989: %% but until that gets the necessary functionality...
 6990: which_local_socket_addr(Domain) ->
 6991:     case ?KLIB:which_local_host_info(Domain) of
 6992:         {ok, [#{addr := Addr}|_]} ->
 6993:             #{family => Domain,
 6994:               addr   => Addr};
 6995:         {error, Reason} ->
 6996:             ?FAIL(Reason)
 6997:     end.

 7002: %% Here are all the *general* test case condition functions.
 7003: 
 7004: etc_issue() ->
 7005:     string:trim(os:cmd("cat /etc/issue")).
 7006: 
 7007: is_old_fedora16() ->
 7008:     is_old_fedora16( etc_issue() ).
 7009: 
 7010: %% We actually only have one host running this, a slow VM.
 7011: is_old_fedora16("Fedora release 16 " ++ _) ->
 7012:     skip("Very slow VM");
 7013: is_old_fedora16(_) ->
 7014:     ok.
 7015: 
 7016: 
 7017: %% This is a bit subjective, but...
 7018: %% ..we have some WMs that is not "fast enough", but the only
 7019: %% thing we can test on is 'esock factor' (other than host name).
 7020: %% This means we actually skip this on platforms where its
 7021: %% not actually needed.
 7022: %% The host in question is a Ubuntu 20.04...
 7023: is_slow_ubuntu(Config) ->
 7024:     case lookup(kernel_factor, 1, Config) of
 7025: 	F when is_integer(F) andalso (F > 1) ->
 7026: 	    case os:type() of
 7027: 		{unix, linux} ->
 7028: 		    case etc_issue() of
 7029: 			"Ubuntu 20.04" ++ _ ->
 7030: 			    skip("Slow Ubuntu host");
 7031: 			_ ->
 7032: 			    ok
 7033: 		    end;
 7034: 		_ ->
 7035: 		    ok
 7036: 	    end;
 7037: 	_ ->
 7038: 	    ok
 7039:     end.
 7040: 
 7041: 
 7042: is_not_solaris() ->
 7043:     case os:type() of
 7044:         {unix, solaris} ->
 7045:             skip("Solaris");
 7046:         _ ->
 7047:             ok
 7048:     end.
 7049: 
 7050: is_not_windows() ->
 7051:     case os:type() of
 7052:         {win32, nt} ->
 7053:             skip("This does not work on Windows");
 7054:         _ ->
 7055:             ok
 7056:     end.
 7057: 
 7058: has_support_unix_domain_socket() ->
 7059:     case socket:is_supported(local) of
 7060: 	true ->
 7061: 	    ok;
 7062: 	false ->
 7063: 	    skip("Not supported")
 7064:     end.
 7065: 
 7066: has_support_sctp() ->
 7067:     case os:type() of
 7068:         {win32, _} ->
 7069:             skip("Not supported");
 7070:         {unix, netbsd} ->
 7071:             %% XXX We will have to investigate this later...
 7072:             skip("Not supported");
 7073:         _ ->
 7074:             case socket:is_supported(sctp) of
 7075:                 true ->
 7076:                     ok;
 7077:                 false ->
 7078:                     skip("Not supported")
 7079:             end
 7080:     end.

 7094: 
 7095: unlink_path(Path) ->
 7096:     unlink_path(Path, fun() -> ok end, fun() -> ok end).
 7097: 
 7098: unlink_path(Path, Success, Failure)
 7099:   when is_function(Success, 0), is_function(Failure, 0) ->
 7100:     case Path of
 7101:         undefined ->
 7102:             ?SEV_IPRINT("not a path to unlink"),
 7103:                     Success();
 7104:         _ ->
 7105:             ?SEV_IPRINT("try unlink path: "
 7106:                         "~n   ~s", [Path]),
 7107:             case file:delete(Path) of
 7108:                 ok ->
 7109:                     ?SEV_IPRINT("path unlinked: "
 7110:                                 "~n   Path: ~s", [Path]),
 7111:                     Success();
 7112:                 Error ->
 7113:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("unlink failed: "
 7114:                                 "~n   Path: ~s"
 7115:                                 "~n   Res:  ~p", [Path, Error]),
 7116:                     Failure()
 7117:             end
 7118:     end.
 7119:

 7135: lookup(Key, Default, Config) ->
 7136:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
 7137:         {value, {Key, Value}} ->
 7138:             Value;
 7139:         _ ->
 7140:             Default
 7141:     end.

 7146: tdiff({A1, B1, C1} = _T1x, {A2, B2, C2} = _T2x) ->
 7147:     T1 = A1*1000000000+B1*1000+(C1 div 1000), 
 7148:     T2 = A2*1000000000+B2*1000+(C2 div 1000), 
 7149:     T2 - T1.

 7159: 
 7160: start_node(Name) ->
 7161:     start_node(Name, 5000).
 7162: 
 7163: start_node(Name, Timeout) when is_integer(Timeout) andalso (Timeout > 0) ->
 7164:     Pa   = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 7165:     Args = ["-pa", Pa,
 7166:             "-s", atom_to_list(?PROXY), "start", atom_to_list(node()),
 7167:             "-s", "global", "sync"],
 7168:     try ?CT_PEER(#{name      => Name,
 7169:                    wait_boot => Timeout,
 7170:                    args      => Args}) of
 7171:         {ok, Peer, Node} ->
 7172:             ?SEV_IPRINT("Started node ~p - now (global) sync", [Name]),
 7173:             global:sync(), % Again, just in case...
 7174:             ?SEV_IPRINT("ping proxy"),
 7175:             pong = ?PPING(Node),
 7176:             {Peer, Node};
 7177:         {error, Reason} ->
 7178:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed starting node ~p (=> SKIP):"
 7179:                         "~n   ~p", [Name, Reason]),
 7180:             skip(Reason)
 7181:     catch
 7182:         Class:Reason:Stack ->
 7183:             ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed starting node: "
 7184:                         "~n   Class:  ~p"
 7185:                         "~n   Reason: ~p"
 7186:                         "~n   Stack:  ~p",
 7187:                         [Class, Reason, Stack]),
 7188:             skip({node_start, Class, Reason})
 7189:     end.
 7190: 
 7191:

 7194: sock_port(S) ->
 7195:     case socket:sockname(S) of
 7196:         {ok, #{port := Port}} -> Port;
 7197:         {ok, #{}}             -> undefined
 7198:     end.

 7201:     list_to_binary(L).

 7204:     binary_to_list(B).

 7206: i(F) ->
 7207:     i(F, []).
 7208: 
 7209: i(F, A) ->
 7210:     FStr = ?F("[~s] " ++ F, [?FTS()|A]),
 7211:     io:format(user, FStr ++ "~n", []),
 7212:     io:format(FStr, []).
 7213:
